alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Coastal Hancock; Northeast Aroostook; Northern Washington; Southeast Aroostook; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 4:49AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect extreme northwestern Washington...southwestern Hancock...southeastern Aroostook and southeastern Penobscot Counties... At 447 AM EDT...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Washburn to 8 miles west of Reed Plantation to near Islesboro...and moving east AT 30 MPH. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Bangor, Presque Isle, Caribou, Old Town, Ellsworth, Houlton, Bucksport, Fort Fairfield, Blue Hill, Limestone, Danforth, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Deer Isle, Mapleton, Veazie, Washburn and Dedham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 182 and 202, and between mile markers 273 and 304. US Highway 1 between Orland and Ellsworth, and between Danforth and Caribou. State Highway 9 between Bangor and Clifton. * Winds up to 20 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. * Snowfall accumulation of up to one inch is expected in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
